.
Requesting Service Records From Alternate Sources
Sometimes, service records are not available at the locations from which ROs normally obtain them.  This is often due to delays in transferring service records from one site to another, the transition to electronic record-keeping, or other major operational disruptions.  Under these circumstances, ROs should follow the designated procedures to obtain the records from alternate sources.
Examples
:  Service records
still in the Veteran's possession are requested
in the Section 5103 notice, and
the final notification letter (if needed)
still with the service department or at a Reserve/National Guard unit, even though the Veteran’s service obligation has ended, can be requested by the VA Liaison Office (VALO) staff working directly with the service departments, and
that were sent to the wrong location during the transition to electronic records can be requested with assistance from VALO.
References
:  For more information on
final notification that VA is unable to obtain relevant Federal records, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 1.A.1.b and e
VALO assistance obtaining
STRs that have not been uploaded to DoD’s Healthcare Artifacts and Images Management Solution (HAIMS), see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.B.1.e
STRs for Veterans discharged during the transition from paper to electronic STRs, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.B.1.l
Army personnel records, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.C.2.b
, and
Marine Corps personnel records, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.C.5.a
, and
listings of service record custodians, their contact information, and the address codes for requesting records from them through PIES, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.E
.
